properties.media:imagetext:
Amb,
062717A
Sanibel, E orida
July 7, 1961
Mr.
Harold M. Bixby
"Topside"
Bolton Landing, New York
Dear Harold -
The Florida Supreme Court seems to be in no hurry to rule
on the
Sanibel causeway bond case.
Will let you know as soon
as they rule.
When I last saw you we discussed the possibility of including
a piece of privately owned property in the proposed Sanibel wild-
life preserve.
This chunk of
land contains about 234 acres and it
is in Sec.
17, T 46 S - R 22 E, and is surrounded by state and
Federal lands.
It is owned by
two separate parties and is listed
for
sale it $350 per acre with the Sanibel-Captiva Real Estate
here.
I am sending a copy of this letter to the president of the
Florida Audubon Society - Mr. John Storer, Under Mountain Road,
Sheffield, Mass.
I believe the Society has some detailed maps of
the area we prepared some time ago.
Mr. Storer has been our contact
with the
I. I. Board in the matter of setting aside some 2,000 acres
of these wet
lands for a permanent wildlife preserve.
Perhaps Mr. Storer has already considered how these privately
owned lands in
Sec. 17 might be included in the preserve.
He has
been most helpful all the way on the
proposa
and is experienced in
setting up projects of this kind.
I an asking him to write you on
the subject.
From the map it seems you are almost summer neighbors.
We are
expecting our three grandsons here next week for a visit.
Never a dull moment then.
in sending best greetings
to you and Mrs. Bixby.
Thanks for the good wishes.
Sincerely,
Willi, Conles
P.S.
The Signet book I am sending you portrays more than i can
say about the author.
Mr. and Mrs. Storer are very fine people.
26BC
